title: How to get music on my phone for the caller to listen to when they are calling - Quora

response.answer_text: Thats called as “Caller tune” Just visit your operator store , or you could google the music you want to set it as caller tune and subscribe to it. (Most of subscriptions are done by texting , for eg : set xyz music and sending that msg to a specific number ) Do note that you may be charged for it to set it as caller tune. For eg : you may be charged 5$/month for that subscription ( depending upon the region you are living in )

You’re referring to what they call a ring back tone. Cellular carriers like AT&T and Verizon can assign songs that people will hear instead of the sound of a phone ringing when they call you. The carrier has to do it on their side; you can’t just do it on your phone. There’s starting to be third party companies that will provide a workaround… WHAT IS A RINGBACK TONE?
